name: Grandma's Slow Cooker Swiss Steak
author: kattykat583
summary: My mom used to make this for me growing up, and I found out it was passed down to her from her mother. A delicious comfort food especially in the winter months that is quick and easy. Best served over mashed potatoes!
ingredients: 2 pounds beef round steak, cut into strips
1 (14.5 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup
1 tablespoon chopped green bell pepper, or more to taste
½ teaspoon browning sauce (such as Kitchen Bouquet®), or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Dredge strips of round steak in flour to coat
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat; brown strips of round steak in the hot oil, 7 to 8 minutes per side
Transfer beef strips to a slow cooker
Add cream of mushroom soup, Cheddar cheese soup, onion, green bell pepper, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, and browning sauce; stir
Season mixture with salt and black pepper
Cook on High and cook 4 hours
